Elemental Weapon

Level 3 Transmutation Spell

Imbue a weapon with elemental power. It receives a +1 bonus to Attack Rolls, and deals an additional 1d4 damage of your choice.

Melee Concentration

Elemental Weapon is a Spell in Baldur's Gate 3. Elemental Weapon is a Lvl 3 Spell from the Transmutation school. Spells can be used for dealing damage to Enemies, inflict Status Ailments, buff Characters or interact with the environment.

BG3 Elemental Weapon Information

Description: Imbue a weapon with elemental power. It receives a +1 bonus to Attack Rolls, and deals an additional 1d4 damage of your choice. Level: Lvl 3 spell School: Transmutation School Casting Time: Action Range: Melee Requires Concentration: Yes Saving Throw: No Lasts Until Long Rest

BG3 Elemental Weapon Variants

Variant Info Elemental Weapon: Acid Has a +1 bonus to Attack Rolls and deals an additional 1d4 Acid damage. Elemental Weapon: Cold Has a +1 bonus to Attack Rolls and deals an additional 1d4 Cold damage. Elemental Weapon: Fire Has a +1 bonus to Attack Rolls and deals an additional 1d4 Fire damage. Elemental Weapon: Lightning Has a +1 bonus to Attack Rolls and deals an additional 1d4 Lightning damage. Elemental Weapon: Thunder Has a +1 bonus to Attack Rolls and deals an additional 1d4 Thunder damage.

How to Acquire Elemental Weapon in Baldur's Gate 3

Elemental Weapon can be acquired by the following classes: Paladin Elemental Weapon can be cast by using the following Items: Drakethroat Glaive as Draconic Elemental Weapon with Recharge: Long rest.
